column2: Experienced bioinformatics leader with 15+ years in computational genomics, data science, and machine learning, driving innovation in multi-omics research
Proven track record in developing and overseeing bioinformatics strategies, optimizing data processing pipelines for genomics, transcriptomics, and epigenomics
Expertise in managing large-scale NGS datasets, ensuring data integrity, reproducibility, and actionable insights for translational and clinical applications
Strong background in leading cross-functional teams, collaborating with researchers, clinicians, and data scientists to advance bioinformatics initiatives
Published scientist with a history of driving impactful research, translating complex genomic data into meaningful discoveries

column7: __Developed SMURF__ (http://smurf.jcvi.org/index.php), a web-based tool for genomic mapping of fungal secondary metabolite clusters, enabling systematic prediction of biosynthetic gene clusters
column8: __Designed algorithms__ to analyze genomic sequences and identify gene clusters responsible for biosynthesis, export, and transcriptional regulation of secondary metabolites
column9: __Enhanced data-driven insights__ into fungal metabolomics, providing researchers with a streamlined approach to studying secondary metabolism

column3: Mood Disorders Center, Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences, The Johns Hopkins University, School of Medicine
column7: __Designed and executed scalable bioinformatics pipelines__ on High-Performance Computing Clusters (HPCCs) for GWAS analysis of mood disorders, integrating Illumina & Affymetrix array data
column8: __Led imputation and statistical analysis__ of GWAS data, enhancing the resolution of genetic association studies
column9: __Conducted a comprehensive meta-analysis__ of candidate gene studies in Bipolar Disorder, identifying statistically significant polymorphisms
column10: __Applied machine learning and data mining techniques__ to analyze high-dimensional genomic data from psychiatric disorders
column11: __Developed analytical workflows__ for genome-wide DNA methylation (DNAm) analysis

column3: Mood Disorders Center, Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Sciences, The Johns Hopkins University, School of Medicine
column7: __Led a systematic review and mega-analysis__ of microarray gene expression studies in brain tissue for mood disorders
column8: __Developed Metamoodics__, a web-based bioinformatics platform integrating genome-wide linkage, expression, and association data for Major Depression and Bipolar Disorder
column9: __Conducted polygenic risk score (PRS) analysis__, linking genetic predisposition to stressful life events and depressive symptoms in older adults
column10: __Designed and implemented HPCC pipelines__ for epigenetic data analysis, including Whole Genome Bisulfite Sequencing (WGBS), to study mood disorder associations

column2: Bioinformatics Staff Scientist & PhD. Research Fellow (in Bioinformatics and Computational Biology)
column3: National Institutes of Health (NIH), National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)
column7: __RNA-Seq (Transcriptomics)__: Led large-scale transcriptomic analyses (GTEx, 11,000+ samples), developing HPCC pipelines for expression quantification, differential analysis, pathway enrichment, eQTL and sQTL mapping
column8: __DNA-Seq (Genomics)__: Designed and implemented HPCC workflows for WGS, WES, targeted DNA-seq, and CRISPR studies, including germline/somatic mutation calling, CNV detection, and mutational burden analysis
column9: __Methyl-Seq (Epigenomics)__: Built WGBS pipelines for genomic and cfDNA analysis, performing CpG methylation analysis, deconvolution for tissue-of-origin identification, and processing ChIP-Seq, CUT&Tag, and CUT&RUN data
column10: __Proteomics__: Applied machine learning models (random forest and mixed-effects modeling) to predict cardiovascular risk using high-density lipoprotein proteome data
column11: __lncRNA Analysis__: Developed lncRNAKB (https://osf.io/ru4d2/), a knowledgebase integrating lncRNA tissue-specificity and disease associations, incorporating cis-eQTL, GWAS associations (UK Biobank), and co-expression modules from GTEx RNA-Seq data

column7: __Leading NGS data analysis__ for clinical trials, exploratory, and research studies, deriving actionable insights for precision medicine
column8: __Developing and optimizing bioinformatics pipelines__, integrating AWS, Docker, CWL, in Seven Bridges and Arvados platforms for scalable, reproducible workflows
column9: __Directing innovative research projects__ on Microsatellite Instability (MSI), alternative splicing analysis, neoantigen prediction, Tumor Mutational Burden (TMB), genetic ancestry analysis, cfDNA nucleosome profiling and RNA-Seq lite in clinical applications
column10: __Designing novel tools and workflows__ to support long-read sequencing (PacBio) data and advanced transcriptomics analyses

column13: Emphasized best practices, troubleshooting, and validation in NGS analysis
